name: Access your teaching qualifications
description: Qualified teachers can use this service to download their teaching certificates, check qualification and early career teacher induction status and change the name on their certificates.

name: Apply to become an Academy
description: Application processes for mainstream and special schools applying to convert to academy status.

name: Apply for qualified teacher status (QTS) in England
description: This service is for qualified teachers who trained outside of England who want to apply for qualified teacher status (QTS) to teach in English schools.

name: Apply for teacher training
description: Use this service to apply for a postgraduate teacher training course to teach in a state primary or secondary school, or in further education.

name: Manage apprenticeships
description: This service is for organisations that want to take on apprentices. Use this service to set up and manage apprenticeship training and pay for apprenticeship training.

name: Calculate teacher pay
description: Calculate teacher pay following the 2023 pay award

name: Student Bursary Support Service
description: The Care to Learn scheme can help with childcare costs while you study.

name: Early years child development training
description: A free, online training course providing an overview of child development and giving practical advice for supporting the development of children in your early years setting.

name: Notify the death or serious harm of a child
description: Notify the Child Safeguarding Practice Review Panel if it's known or suspected that a child has been abused or neglected.

name: Find school and college performance data in England
description: Search for primary, secondary and special needs schools and colleges near you, and check their performance.

name: Connect families to support
description: Use this service to find voluntary and community services to support the families you work with.

name: Develop your career in child and family social work
description: Find development programmes for child and family social workers at different stages of your career.

name: DfE Connect
description: You can use DfE Connect to access DfE services and guidance relating to finance and funding, manage tasks such as school census and accounts return, view deadlines, policy updates and best practice guides.

name: Find and Use an API
description: Connect to the Department for Education (DfE) digital services through our APIs.

name: Explore education statistics
description: Find, download and explore official Department for Education statistics and data in England.

name: Find a learning aim
description: Find the latest information on available Qualifications, Standards, Apprenticeships, T Levels and Units.

name: Find a lost teacher reference number (TRN)
description: Use this service to find your teacher reference number (TRN) if you do not know it or have forgotten it, or to check if you have a TRN.

name: Find a teaching school hub
description: Use this service to find the contact details and websites of teaching school hubs near you.

name: Find an apprenticeship
description: Search the find an apprenticeship service for apprenticeships in England.

name: Find a DfE-approved framework for your school
description: Find quality-checked suppliers of goods and services for your school.

name: Find schemes for your business
description: A range of government programmes, are available for employers who are considering hiring employees, offering work experience or upskilling existing staff, some of which offer financial incentives.

name: Find an end-point assessment organisation for your apprentice
description: Find an organisation to assess your apprentice at the end of their apprenticeship. This is known as an 'end-point assessment'.

name: National Pupil Database (NPD)
description: Use this tool to find and explore information about the data that is held in the NPD, a key DfE data store, covering education, skills and children services data for individual learners in England.

name: Find support for your family
description: You can find help, services and activities in your local area, including activities, support for parents and carers, support with special educational needs and disabilities and help with mental health,relationships, money, housing or family life.

name: Find teacher training courses
description: Find teaching courses in England if you want to teach in a state primary or secondary school, or in further education.

name: Find a traineeship
description: A traineeship is a course with work experience that gets you ready for work or an apprenticeship. It can last from 6 weeks up to 1 year, though most traineeships last for less than 6 months.

name: Find apprenticeship training for your apprentice
description: If you're an employer, you can find training for your apprentices.

name: Get an international relocation payment
description: The international relocation payment (IRP) is a single payment of 10,000, funded by the UK government, which is available to eligible non-UK trainees and teachers of languages, physics and general or combined science when that includes physics.

name: Get help buying for schools
description: Use this service to create a specification for a new catering service for a single school in England.

name: Get help to retrain
description: The service allowed users to create an action plan to help them identify another type of work they could move into and what training might be available nearby to support them in their application.

name: Get help with Education and Skills Funding Agency services
description: Self-service support options for education providers hosted by the ESFA.

name: Get help with technology
description: Information for local authorities, academy trusts and schools about the devices, internet access and support available to provide remote education and access to children's social care during coronavirus (COVID-19).

name: Get information about pupils
description: Secure access to confidential pupil data.

name: Get information about schools
description: This is a register of schools and colleges in England. You can search for and download information on establishments, establishment groups or governors. Schools, local authorities and academy trusts can also update details by signing in to their Secure Access account.

name: Get Into Teaching
description: A service which aims to inspire, inform and support people who are interested in training to become a teacher.

name: Get an adviser
description: If you're thinking about teaching in England, an adviser can provide free, one-to-one support through phone, text or email.

name: Help for early years providers
description: Guidance for people who work in early years, from the Department for Education.

name: Improve workload and wellbeing for school staff
description: Use the service to help you promote staff wellbeing and support workload reduction in your school, with free resources that are produced by school leaders, for school leaders, support what you're already doing and can be adapted to work in your school.

name: Manage family support services and accounts
description: This service is for people working in local authorities or voluntary and community sector organisations. It allows you to manage your organisation and services on Connect families to support and Find support for your family.

name: Manage training for early career teachers
description: This service is for induction tutors who have been nominated by their school Use this service to manage your school's statutory induction programme for early career teachers.

name: National Careers Service
description: Information, advice and guidance to help you make decisions on learning, training and work.

name: Plan technology for your school
description: This is a self-assessment service to determine how your school is using technologyand what your school can do to use technology better in future.

name: Professional development for teachers and leaders
description: Take a specialist national professional qualification (NPQ) to enhance and develop your existing skills and knowledge both inside and outside of the classroom.

name: Publish teacher training courses
description: Use this service to publish information about initial teacher training courses.

name: List of Qualifications approved for funding
description: This website contains funding approval information for all of the qualifications funded through the qualification offers in England (except apprenticeships and traineeships).

name: Recruit an apprentice
description: This service is for registered training providers (including large employers with direct grant funding) to post vacancies and manage applications for apprenticeships and traineeships.

name: Register of apprenticeship training providers service
description: The Register of Apprenticeship Training Providers (RoATP) is a list of organisations that are eligible to receive government funding to train apprentices.

name: Register for a National Professional Qualification
description: This service is for teachers who want to register to study for a National Professional Qualification (NPQ).
